metadata.title: CVE-2019-11036 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
When processing certain files, PHP EXIF extension in versions 7.1.x below7.1.29, 7.2.x below 7.2.18 and 7.3.x below 7.3.5 can be caused to read pastallocated buffer in exif_process_IFD_TAG function. This may lead toinformation disclosure or crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.5

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
